fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Test connection button becomes disabled once there is an error in the form.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Jira with OAuth2 integration

 # Go to Incoming Mail page (type . ~~ and then Incoming Mail)

 # Click Add mail server (or Edit on existing one)

 # Select OAuth2 integration as Authentication method and perform Authorization 

 # Fill the form in a way there will be error in it (e. g. leave Name field empty)

 # Click Test Connection button

h3. Expected Results

Test fails and messages about error in the form is displayed. Test Connection button is still enabled.
h3. Actual Results

Test fails and messages about error in the form is displayed. *Test Connection button becomes disabled.*
h3. Workaround

To have Test Connection button enabled again one must perform Authorization procedure once more.
fields.summary: Testing connection with server authenticated with OAuth2 in add/update server page while having errors in the form will disable Test Connection button after one trial

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A duplicate Team field breaks links created by the Pie Chart gadget

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a custom field with the name Team
2. Configure the Pie Chart gadget to use Team as the Statistic Type
3. Click the link to a Team on the Pie Chart gadget, ON board Team in the example below:

!link.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results
The link will load a page displaying the results of an issue search containing the desired results:

!issues.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results
The link will load a page displaying an issue search with an error:
!error.png!

h3. Workaround

Advanced Roadmaps for Jira uses the Team custom field name. Removing the Team custom field, and preventing the duplicate custom field name will avoid this problem.
fields.summary: Duplicate Team field breaks links created by the Pie Chart gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the admin creates a transition which limits the visibility of an issue, the agents getting stuck on a loading screen. When the agent then refreshes the page, the are presented with a permissions error (as expected).

This was reported via the Atlassian community: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-questions/How-to-redirect-agent-to-custom-screen-after-transition/qaq-p/1335476]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an agent who does not have access to view issues when they are in a particular status
 ## You can achieve this by editing workflow and adding "jira.permission.browse.group = some-group" in the status properties. Also some other useful info can be found [here|https://www.j-tricks.com/tutorials/permissions-based-on-workflow-status].
 # Create a transition which transitions issues to the status above which the agent cannot view
 # As the agent transition the issue to this status
 # Observe the page stuck loading (should not happen)
 # Refresh and observe the permissions error (expected)

h3. Expected Results

Agent is redirect to the portal home page, or allow the transition to define a redirect page to land on.
h3. Actual Results

The agent is stuck on a loading page.
h3. Workaround

Refresh and then redirect back to the portal
fields.summary: When an agent transitions an issue to a status they do not have permission to, they are stuck on a loading page

fields.description: Ein "[~username]" wird in Überschriften nicht gerendert und bleibt ein "[~username]"!
fields.summary: Nutzer-Links funktionieren nicht in Überschriften

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, information about which Tomcat version is included with each Jira release is not easily available. Such information is useful when
 planning a Jira upgrade, for example, to get around Tomcat vulnerabilities on specific versions.
h3. Suggested Solution

A document that is similar to [Bundled Tomcat and Java versions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/bundled-tomcat-and-java-versions-1005786018.html] which currently available for Confluence.
h3. Workaround

[Finding the Bundled Tomcat Version Per JIRA Release|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/finding-the-bundled-tomcat-version-per-jira-release-779291457.html]
 A current possible workaround would be to download the archive release of a Jira version and check which Tomcat version is included, but as this can be time-consuming when checking different versions, making this information more readily available would be an improvement.
fields.summary: Document Tomcat versions for different Jira releases

fields.description:
currently, if I create an app link from: 
JIRA > Bitbucket let's say, all users if they have developer permissions, will see the following if there is dev panel info:
 !image-2020-06-04-13-18-36-978.png|thumbnail! 
Now, if I have multiple git based apps linked, I may be challenged for authentication to view the dev panel info, _even_ if I don't have permissions to view the repo on the Bitbucket side. And even worse, if the user has never logged into this Bitbucket instance but is being auto-added to the application default group on log in, this can consume a license. 
Proposed Fix: 
Allow the ability to define permissible groups on the app link itself, therefor only users that actually have permissions on the back end repos will be challenged for auth, saving time, money and frustration.
fields.summary: Allow permissions groups to only allow certain users to applinks

fields.description:

Few external links are being lost while editing comments in Jira

 # Add the comment.
 # click on edit comment and try to add few more links in both text and visual mode, some links will go missing

Note: 
Seems like this issue is somehow linked to badly formatted urls, something like:

{noformat}
[ link title 3| [http://example.com|http://example.com/]
{noformat}
that happens when you put spaces in random places and switch from visual to text mode a lot.

Attached the video of the issue replication

h3. Expected Results
 All links should be visible and customers should be able to open

h3. Actual Results
Some links go missing or lost while editing comment 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Although Jira is in the Turkish language, Date Picker is displayed in English. When creating an issue and picking a date (e.g. Due Date), Jira shows the following error:
 !Jira error.png!

This problem was just found in Business Projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the language of your profile to Turkish
 # Create a business project
 # Have a field that uses the Date Picker on the create issue screen, e.g., Due Date
 # Pick a date and try to create the issue

h3. Expected Results

When choosing a Date, the months and days should be in Turkish.
h3. Actual Results

Days and months are displayed in English, even though Jira is in Turkish. It displays an error saying the date format is incorrect.
{noformat}
You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format"d/MM/yy", eg.3/Haz/20
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Users can manually change the language of the month, eg. 3/Jun/20 into 3/Haz/20

OR

Use Jira in English instead of Turkish.
fields.summary: Date Picker in Business Projects is displayed in English while using Jira in Turkish, displaying Date format error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The two dimensional statistics gadget shows wrong value for 'None' when there is multi-select-list custom field in the axis. Also, redirects to a wrong filter when clicked on the value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create custom field with multiple choices (eg. custom field named Browsers, can have internet browser as options - IE, Edge, Firefox, Chrome etc.)
2. Create a simple filter like "project = TEST and issuetype = Bug"
Add Two dimensional filter statistics gadget to your dashboard specifying the filter from Step 1
3. Set XAxis = some multi-select-list custom fields
4. Set YAxis = epic link
5. Save the filter.

h3. Expected Results
The 'None' value will show the empty fields and clicking on the value will take to the JQL correctly.
h3. Actual Results
The 'None' values are shown wrong data and when clicking on the value, the previously clicked filter result is displayed.
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Two dimensional filter statistics gadget showing wrong values for 'None' on X axix

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Problem related to new method of authentication of incoming mail servers.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create new OAuth 2.0 integration in Jira (Administration > System OAuth 2.0)
 # Create new incoming mail server integration (Administration > Incoming mail > Add new Mail server)
 # Select integration from Step 1 as authorization method in new mail server integration.
 # Remove OAuth 2.0 integration from Step 1.
 # Restart Jira or wait for cache invalidation (around 30 minutes). Removing an another mail server configuration also triggers cache invalidation

h3. Expected Results

Jira work without problem.
h3. Actual Results

Every page in Jira returns 500 errors due to cache creation problems
h3. Workaround

Remove from database table `MAILSERVER` entry for mail server associated with removed OAuth2 integration
fields.summary: Removing OAuth2 integration used by incoming mail server integration makes Jira return 500 error for every page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When attaching HEIC file into Jira, it will be attached without Thumbnails. When clicking on the file, it will download the file rather than show a preview. There are also cases where clicking the file would prompt the preview window displaying an error message.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Jira to support HEIC file format attachment so that it will be treated just like other image formats (e.g.: PNG, JPG)

Alternatively, Jira could also automatically convert the attached HEIC file into the supported format.

h3. Workaround 
Manually convert the HEIC format to the supported format before attaching
fields.summary: Support HEIC file format attachment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a dashboard/filter is shared to Public("Anyone on the web"), but _Sharing with anyone_
 _on the web_ is turned +OFF+, when attempting to +Change Owner+, the admin receives the following error:
{panel:bgColor=#f8d7da}
(x) Dashboards and filters in this Jira instance cannot be shared with anyone on the web anymore. If you want to modify this item, you must change the Shares so that it is not shared with anyone on the web.
{panel}
It may be impossible to change the ownership of that filter/dashboard if the filter/dashboard is owned by someone else (potentially who is no longer contactable), and the admin does not have +Edit+ permissions, because the admin is not able to edit existing permissions unless they are the owner, or have (EDIT) permissions (JRASERVER-41269)

Users fixing filters/dashboards that need to be remediated is harder due to JRASERVER-68523
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Jira Admin -> System -> General Configuration -> Sharing with anyone on the web: *ON*
 # Create a dashboard. You are the owner of this dashboard.
 # Share the dashboard to Anyone on the web (VIEW)
 # Jira Admin -> System -> General Configuration -> Sharing with anyone on the web: *OFF*
 # Jira Admin -> System -> Shared Dashboards
 # Find your dashboard and click *Change Owner*
 # Attempt to change the owner to someone else
 ## (!) The error is shown

h3. Expected Results

The dashboard ownership is changed. The admin can then remove the _Anyone on the web_ share setting.
h3. Actual Results

The admin receives the error above and is unable to remove the share.
h3. Workaround
 # Temporarily enable public sharing via Jira Admin -> System -> General Configuration -> Sharing with anyone on the web: *OFF*
 # Remove the _Anyone on the web_ share from the affected filter(s)/dashboard(s)
 # Disable public sharing via Jira Admin -> System -> General Configuration -> Sharing with anyone on the web: *OFF*
fields.summary: Unable to change dashboard/filter ownership if shared to public but Public Sharing is turned off

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to link issue between instance A and B where user doesnt have application access in instance B, it will throw:
{quote}
The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.
{quote}
This is misleading for system admin. No error is thrown in the log either.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create application link between instance A and instance B.
# Grant user X the application access of instance A, but not instance B.
# Link issue in instance A with issue in instance B.

h3. Expected Results
Error message will be thrown stating user doesnt have application access in another instance.

h3. Actual Results
It throws the following error as soon as user tries to type the issue key:
{quote}
The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.
{quote}
without any error in the log either.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Misleading error message when linking issue without application access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Normally, the issue collectors would return a feedback to the user after the form was submitted.

Currently, it is failing to render a message. Instead, the form just goes blank, and there is an error message in the browser console:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-01 at 13.22.53.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create an issue collector;
 * Copy its script, and paste in in a file like this one: [^test.html]
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-01 at 13.35.22.png|thumbnail!
 * Launch it in your browser (e.g. Chrome);
 * Try to submit the form.

h3. Expected Results

The issue is created, and there is a success message after the form submission.
h3. Actual Results

The issue is created, but the form just goes blank after the form submission.

The following error is displayed n the bowser console:
{code:java}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'attachment_error' of null
    at n (com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:form-collector.js?locale=en-US:3)
    at Object.success (com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:form-collector.js?locale=en-US:3)
    at Object.a.success (batch.js?locale=en-US:1419)
    at HTMLIFrameElement.g (batch.js?locale=en-US:1413)
{code}
h3. Workaround

Use different browsers(Firefox, Safari,etc) other than Chrome.

The issue seems to be fixed in Chrome 83.0.4103.97.
fields.summary: Issue collector visual bug after form submission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an issue is archived e.g. an Epic. There is currently no indication on linked or child issues, that the linked issue has been archived. So owners of linked issues who need to update their links don't have a way of identifying that they are still linked to an archived (potentially obsolete) issue, and may not know to make necessary changes e.g. re-link to a more current issue.

 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a form of visual marker (e.g. an automatic *Archived* label) on Epic or other Issue links, if the linked issue happens to be archived.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to identify archived issues in issue or epic links

fields.description:
When customers use our Azure/AWS templates to spin up a Data Center environment in Azure/AWS, there is not feature to restart Jira application on server reboot. Customers would like to have this feature in order to use auto scaling features in cloud infrastructure.

Currently this is not supported and customers need to configure the service start-up configurations manually. Hence this feature request. Based on feasibility, please help customers with this new feature.
fields.summary: Jira startup in Azure - on Server reboot

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Jira does not support true Typeahead searches when adding fix versions, components, labels, and other fields as such. As an example, if a version named {{1.12.13/charlie}} exists in the project, users will not be able to add it to the Fix Version/s field by simply typing "Charlie" - for the user to find this version, it will need to type {{1.12.13/}} before they are able to find the {{charlie}} version.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add true Typeahead support to the Jira system fields.

h3. Why this is important
This provides a better user experience where they are able to filter and search labels/components/versions using any section of the string.
fields.summary: Add true Typeahead support to system fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Focus is shifting to top of the page when issues are edited from the list after getting the list through filters/JQL
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any existing filter or write a new JQL query to get a list of issues.
 # Scroll down to the latter half of the page, go to “...” > Edit > (Any changes in the Issues’ Edit Screen) > click Update. Now you see the control/focus is taken to the top of the page. You have to scroll down to see the same issue.
 # Scroll down to the later half of the page, go to “...” > Edit > Change the status of the Issue (InProgress/Done/any other). The control/focus is taken to the top of the page. When you scroll down to the issue where status was changed, it is not reflected. The status change will be reflected after ‘refreshing’ the page. (Refresh and scroll down where the issue was listed)

h3. Expected Results
 * The focus of the page should remain on the Issue which was edited.
 * If Issues’ status is changed, it should be reflected right away, and the focus of the page should stay on the row where the issue was edited.

h3. Actual Results
 * After editing the issue, the focus of the page is shifted and taken to the top of the page. Need to scroll down to the original issue’s row.
 * After changing the status of the issue, change is not reflected right away. We need to refresh the page and scroll back to the row in which issue was present

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page alignment and status change issue after editing Issue list through filters/JQL query

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
One can specify a single XML file containing entities data when using the *Restore system* funcionality. When this is done, Jira will only import entities and skip importing ActiveObjects entirely. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate an XML backup by navigating to *Cog Icon > System > Backup system.*
# Place the generated zip file inside {{JIRA_HOME/import}} and unzip it in order to expose the files {{entities.xml}} and {{activeobjects.xml}}.
# Navigate to *Cog Icon > System > Restore system* and fill in the value *{{entities.xml}}* for the field *File name*.
# Click *Restore*.

h3. Expected Results
Jira should only accept a zip file containing both {{entities.xml}} and {{activeobjects.xml}}, aborting the process if a different file type is specified.

h3. Actual Results
Jira will only import the entities in the provided file, and nothing else. ActiveObjects import will be completely skipped.

This will cause all information stored in AO tables to not be imported. Such data includes:
* Agile boards.
* Sprints.
* Issue ranking data.
* Webhooks.
* Most data used by Atlassian's or third-party apps.

No errors or exceptions regarding partial data being imported are logged.

h3. Workaround
Make sure to specify a zip file containing both {{entities.xml}} and {{activeobjects.xml}}.
fields.summary: System restore functionality skips ActiveObjects data import if a single XML file is specified

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sometimes sprint health gadget" shows data from old sprint or closed sprint rather than showing data from recent active sprints "

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# I created a sprint test3 and start working on it.
# After that, I create a sprint health gadget in my dashboard and selected the sprint test3.
# After completing/closing that sprint, I created another sprint named sprint 4 which is active
# After that, I checked the dashboard (sprint health gadget) and it was still showing sprint 3 rather than sprint 4.
# The refreshing browser did not help as well.


h3. Expected Results
It should show data for only active sprint and gadget should refresh automatically to show the active sprint details 

h3. Actual Results
The gadget did not refresh and shows data for closed sprint 


h3. Workaround
We can edit the dashboard and change the sprint manually and save the dashboard again to view data for the active sprint.

fields.description:
When a board is built it will not associate with a project it is pulling from when the query is using category the way it will with using the project field.

e.g.

team = 100 and project in (A, B, C)  – this filter can be used to build a board and will associate with each project.

 

team = 100 and category = D  – if the projects A, B, C have been added to the project category D and return the exact same results, this filter will NOT connect to the associated projects. 

Being that category is associated with projects it should associate the boards with projects in the same manner.  In the first example I have to go to every board and update it if want to add a project to it and keep them associated.  With the second I merely have to update the project to the appropriate category.
fields.summary: Use Project Category to associate boards to projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When copying some texts into a preformatted box, in some situations it removes the line breaks.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

I found 2 distinct situations in which the line breaks vanish in the preformatted box:
 # HTML content. That means when you copy some content and it goes as HTML content to the clipboard. It happens on Word, Visual Studio, Web browsers... anything that keeps the formatting over the clipboard.
 # When there is *more than one line break with carriage return in a row*, it removes all of them instead of at least leaving one behind. This applies to Windows notepad, putty, and so on.
On Mac, for example, it's common to have only line breaks without the carriage returns, and it removes _only_ the several in a row, leaving one behind.

h3. Expected Results

In all cases, the text paste should behave in the same way.
h3. Actual Results

Depending on the text line breaks form, it behaves differently.

For example, let's take the text:
{noformat}
        <name>Issue Comment Deleted</name>
        <template>issueupdated.vm</template>


        <templatetype>issueevent</templatetype>
    </templatemapping>
{noformat}
If it has only line feeds, and it's copied to the preformatted box, we get the expected result:
{noformat}
        <name>Issue Comment Deleted</name>
        <template>issueupdated.vm</template>
        <templatetype>issueevent</templatetype>
    </templatemapping>{noformat}
If it uses line feed+ carriage return, we get an extra line break removed:
{noformat}
        <name>Issue Comment Deleted</name>
        <template>issueupdated.vm</template><templatetype>issueevent</templatetype>
    </templatemapping>{noformat}
If copied from Visual Studio Code, or any browser that does it in HTML in the clipboard:
{noformat}
        <name>Issue Comment Deleted</name>        <template>issueupdated.vm</template>

        <templatetype>issueevent</templatetype>    </templatemapping>{noformat}
h3. Workaround

To use the "code" format box, or paste into the text mode.
fields.summary: Pasting into prefotmatted box removes line breaks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Submitting the edit form for an issue containing a cascading select without child option in Jira 8.8.1 and 8.9.0 clears the parent option.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a cascading custom field with any parent and child options
2. Create an issue or edit any existing issue so that the parent option is set and child option remains "None"
3. Open issue edit form ("Edit" button on the issue view) and submit it without any changes

h3. Expected Results
The issue is not changed

h3. Actual Results
The parent option was removed from the issue

The information about the removed parent option is stored in the issue history

h3. Workaround
You can edit a velocity template for the cascading select custom field to fix this issue.
To do so:
# open the file _<JIRA_INSTALLATION>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/fields/edit/edit-cascadingselect.vm_.
# There, edit the code on line 48 from:
#* 
{code}
        #if ($databaseParent && !$hadSelectedChildOption)
{code}
#* to:
{code}
        #if ($databaseChild && !$hadSelectedChildOption)
{code}
# After applying the change, save the file and restart the Jira node.

In Jira DC, the workaround needs to be applied separately for every node.
fields.summary: Editing an issue with cascading select without child option clears the parent option

fields.description: Jira ships with a custom build of {{atlassian-plugins}} library ({{5.2.3-96cf760eb}}). This creates a risk that Jira team themselves will need to backport any bugfixes that will apply to {{5.2}} branch.
fields.summary: Update atlassian-plugins dependency to use official version

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For issue webhooks, the content of the webhook (the representation of the issue) will be localized according to the language preference of the user who created or updated the issue. As webhook consumers may not use the same language, it makes more sense to always send webhooks in the system language.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue updated webhook
# Change your user language preference to a non-English language like Spanish or German or French
# Update an issue
# Observe the webhook that is sent. Notice that the issue type names, descriptions, and possibly resolution values are localized

h3. Expected Results
Webhook data is retained as per the default language set in General Configuration.

h3. Actual Results
Webhook data is localized as per the user language preference. 
{code}
      "status": {
        "self": "http://localhost:8080/j881/rest/api/2/status/10200",
        "description": "",
        "iconUrl": "http://localhost:8080/j881/",
        "name": "A faire",
        "id": "10200",
        "statusCategory": {
          "self": "http://localhost:8080/j881/rest/api/2/statuscategory/2",
          "id": 2,
          "key": "new",
          "colorName": "blue-gray",
          "name": "À faire"
        }
{code}

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround available.
fields.summary: Webhook content should not be localized

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever you access a scheme's page, Jira allows you to display a list of the projects currently using. However, if there are more than 15 projects sharing this scheme (permission, priority, field configuration), the application will display the first 15 projects and then list the others as hidden.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
Assign more than 15 projects to the same scheme, let's use Y for this value.
 # Step 2
Access this scheme's page on Jira's administrative panel.

h3. Expected Results

The entire list of projects using the scheme will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

Only the first 15 projects are displayed and then Jira displays the following message: 

{quote}
and X hidden projects.
{quote}

where 15 + X = Y. As we can see in the screenshot below:

 !Screen Shot 2020-05-22 at 17.54.54.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Projects sharing the same scheme are listed as hidden

fields.description:
As a member of the UX team, we work closely with dev teams often. Because we're on separate teams, we manage tasks on separate Jira boards even though cards flow through parallel processes. 

As a member of UX team alongside a dev team, I'd like to move stories to the UX Jira board so we can manage and track the story before handing it back to development.

Currently, cloning a matter exists but it's not directional; the card appears below the cloned Jira card. Instead, I want to be able to clone a Jira Card specifically to a different art board.

It would be awesome if I could track that same Jira card between both boards from one, but baby steps.

I also want to do this in bulk.
fields.summary: Duplicate To...

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue containing a long string in the description field is displayed in a filter results gadget, the description column is expanded beyond the fixed size of the gadget. This pushes any columns following the description out of view, causing confusion for end users. Likewise, if the gadget is paginating results, one or some pages will resize the description field as above, while others display "normally" with all of the field columns being displayed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and add an extremely long string to the description field.
 # Create a search filter which includes this issue along with some other issues.
 # Create a dashboard and add the Filter Results gadget; configured to use the filter above.
 # Move the description field to the first position in the column order.
 # View the dashboard and notice how the fields after the description column are not visible. (You can scroll to the right to find them)

h3. Expected Results

All fields/columns should be visible in the gadget at all times without having to scroll to the right to see them. A single column should not be auto-resized to take up the entire gadget.
h3. Actual Results

The description column is being resized ad infinitum based on the length of the longest string.
h3. Workaround

Break up the long strings with manual carriage returns so that the column is resized appropriately, and so that other columns are visible.
fields.summary: Long description string expands column outside of filter results gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Performing development related activities such as creating commits, branches, pull requests will cause the related issue to disappear from the active sprint board.

-Please note that this behavior cannot be reproduced reliably and the steps to reproduce will need to be repeated several times.- 

As of 19.11.20 the bug is reproducible every time.
h3. -Steps to Reproduce-
 # -Start a sprint-
 # -Create a new issue-
 # -Add the issue to active sprint by editing sprint field on the issue-
 # -Transition Issue-
 # -Create a branch for issue via Jira-
 # -Create a Pull request-
 # -Transition Issue-

h4. -Steps to Reproduce 2-
 # -Start a sprint-
 # -Create issue-
 # -Add issue to active sprint by editing sprint field on issue-
 # -Transition issue-
 # -Commit a new message with the issue key-
 # -Check the sprint board-

*Actual steps to reproduce*
 # Create a sprint
 # Create an issue
 # Commit a new message with the issue key on EVERY devstatus.applink:thread (either make sure with additional logging, or just do it multiple times with some time space between pushes). You have to make sure that the same thread will perform a commit before and after assigning the issue to a sprint.
 # Assign the issue to the sprint
 # Commit yet another message with the same issue key
 # Check the sprint board

h3. Expected Results

The issues should be visible on the active sprint board
h3. Actual Results

Check the Sprint board - the issue disappears from the board
 # In this example, we can see issue *AH-3* is added to the Sprint field for *AH Sprint 1* but we cannot see the issue on the active sprint board:
 !image-2020-05-26-22-52-47-459.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-05-26-22-52-57-131.png|thumbnail!
 # Perform a project re-index and issue re-appears
 !image-2020-05-26-22-54-55-367.png|thumbnail!

(i) -It is very hard to reproduce the issue reliably. After countless commits, we manage to reproduce the problem again ( AH-4 this time )-
 !image-2020-05-26-22-57-14-737.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-05-26-22-57-25-506.png|thumbnail!

As of 19.11.20 the issue can be reproduced reliably every time, as seen on the following screenshot: 
 !j821n1_8080_jira_secure_RapidBoard.jspa_rapidView=1&view=planning&selectedIssue=TEST-30&issueLimit=100.png|thumbnail!

Checking this SQL output, the database returns correctly which confirms the problem with the indexes :
{code:java}
select cfv.issue as issueid, cfv.stringvalue as SprintNumber, ao."NAME" as SprintName, cf.cfname, p.pkey || '-' || jissue.IssueNum as IssueKey, cf.id As SprintCfid
from
CustomFieldValue cfv,
CustomField cf,
jiraissue jissue,
project p,
"AO_60DB71_SPRINT" ao
where
cf.cfname='Sprint'and
cf.Id = cfv.CustomField and
jissue.id = cfv.issue and
jissue.project = p.Id and
cf.cfname='Sprint' and
ao."NAME" like '%<SPRINT_NAME>%'
{code}
!image-2020-05-26-22-58-37-244.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use the reindex rest API as a work around for the issues that are impacted: [https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.9.0/#api/2/reindex-reindexIssues]
fields.summary: Development Activity breaks Sprint indexes

fields.description:
h3. Issue description

Jira Mail Handler of types *Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue* and *Create a new issue from each email message* can't be edited if they have been created with an incorrect Project / Issue Type combination.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 - Create 2 Jira projects using different Issue Type Schemes. For example:
 -- 1 project only has 1 issue type (Bug) -> let's call this project "Awesome"
 -- 1 project only has 1 issue type (Story) -> let's call this project "Awesomeness"
 - Go to the page *⚙ > System > Incoming Mails*
 - Configure a Mail Server (POP or IMAP)
 - Click on the *Add incoming mail handler* button to create a new mail handler
 - Select the type *Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue*, and click on the *Next* button
 - Select the project "Awesome" and the issue type "Bug"
 !Step1.png|thumbnail!
 - Change the project from "Awesome" to "Awesomeness"
 -- (!) Notice that the issue type field is now empty, because the "Bug" issue type does not exist in the project "Awesomeness"
 !Step2.png|thumbnail!
 - Click on the *Add* button to save this mail handler (with an empty issue type)
 -- (!) Notice that the mail handler was created with the Project "Awesomeness" and the issue type "Bug" *which does not exist in this project
 !Step3.png|thumbnail!
 - Click on the *Edit* button next to this mail handler
 - Click on the *Next* button to edit the configuration of this mail handler

h3. Expected behavior

We should be redirected to the page that allows us to configure various settings such as Project, Issue Type, Strip Quotes, Catch Email Address, etc...
h3. Actual behavior
 - We are redirected to the page *⚙ > System > Incoming Mail* and the screen is frozen/greyed
 - The only way to get out of this page is to hit the *Esc* key
 - The following error is displayed in the Browse Console logs
{code:java}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'get' of undefined
    at d.setSelectedId (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US:33)
    at d.changeSelected (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US:39)
    at HTMLSelectElement.dispatch (batch.js?locale=en-US:44)
    at HTMLSelectElement.v.handle (batch.js?locale=en-US:44)
    at Object.trigger (batch.js?locale=en-US:44)
    at Object.c.event.trigger (batch.js?locale=en-US:64)
    at HTMLSelectElement.<anonymous> (batch.js?locale=en-US:44)
    at Function.each (batch.js?locale=en-US:33)
    at c.fn.init.each (batch.js?locale=en-US:29)
    at c.fn.init.trigger (batch.js?locale=en-US:44)
{code}
!Step4.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

The only know workaround is to delete this corrupted mail handler, and to re-create it with a valid combination of project and issue type.
fields.summary: Jira Mail Handler Configuration can't be edited when using an incorrect project / issue type combination

fields.description:
h3. Scope

Advanced Roadmaps for Jira Server (JPOSERVER)

_(I don't seem to be able to select JPOSERVER as a project when creating this suggestion. Possibly due to the rename? Please move my ticket to the correct project.)_
h3. Problem Definition

Allow roll up of values from child issues to the parent for custom numeric fields.

Currently, when a user enables roll up in the view settings, Advanced Roadmaps performs roll ups for a set of predefined (system) fields:

 * releases

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We are missing {{relaxedPathChars="[]|" relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"}} parameters, required since Jira 12, in the connector example provided in "Step 2. Update Tomcat with the KeyStore" of our https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0712/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-959314173.html documentation. Issue exists in all version documentations since Jira 12.2

h3. Suggested Solution
All server.xml samples in this documentation should include these parameters. 
{code}
relaxedPathChars="[]|" relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"
{code}
Jira will not start without them. See [Jira server startup fails with Tomcat misconfigured error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-server-startup-fails-with-tomcat-misconfigured-error-958453799.html]
fields.summary: Missing critical tomcat connector parameters in Running Jira over SSL documentation

fields.description:
We have various Jira instances - production, staging, UAT. They all have different base urls. And also different header colors to make it easy to tell them apart. Making changes in a prod Jira when you thought it was staging is not good.

As I was using the Jira Server mobile app I realized that the only way you can tell which Jira instance you are connected to is to look at the Settings gear, where the Admin, Settings, Title is shown. The problem with this is that we don't change that title in our different Jira instances because doing that can break Application Links, and the title isn't really shown anywhere in the UI.

So at the moment it's easy to make a change in a Jira instance without knowing which one you are connected to.

My suggestion is to add some way to tell mobile users when they look at an issue that they are not connected to their production Jira. Production Jira issues should not look any different

One way to do this would be to have a custom renderer that adds a prefix to the content of some field saying "Non Prod" based on checking the base url. But that's pretty specific to each customer.

If there were a setting in Jira admin properties that by default says the Jira is production, and then admins change that setting in non-prod instances, then the mobile app could use this info to change something about how the issue appears.
fields.summary: Identify non-production Jira instance in Jira Server mobile app
Selecting both board types in View All Boards page result in not displaying any board

fields.description:
Whenever you complete a sprint on a board, Jira displays a message informing how many issues have been completed and how many remain incomplete. 

Then the application displays a message informing that it will move all issues to the next sprint, but if an issue is part of the sprint A (i.e. sprint field = sprint A) and has been removed from the scope of the board (by its filter). Jira will not move these issues.

This appears to be the application's expected behavior. Would it be possible to account for these issues before displaying the message?

 !Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 12.57.31.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve the message displayed when completing a Sprint.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In some cases, Software users will forward a notification from a Software project with the issue. The email is forwarded to a Service Desk mail handler to create a Service Desk case in reference to the Software project (not issue linking).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a Software project
 # Receive an email notification
 # Forward that notification to a Service Desk Project

h3. Expected Results

A new issue is created *or* Jira does not process the email with a failure reason

h3. Actual Results

Jira processes the email by giving a "success" in the mail log in the UI and marks the email as read. Jira does not create a ticket or update an issue.

h3. Workaround

 There is no workaround outside of customer retraining (to not include the issue number in the subject for a new issue)
fields.summary: Sending an email to a Service Project with a Software/Core issue key, Jira marks the ticket as "read" but does nothing else

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrading Jira software server and Jira service desk server (not data center), upon restart, the Audit log migration is taking place and is taking a long time to finish. Adding the "{{jira.advanced.audit.log.migration.limit=10}}" parameter had no effect.  Based on the Upgrade notes, this supposed to take place in the backgroud, but that is not the case. 
  
 In the [jira-software-8-8-x-upgrade-notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-8-x-upgrade-notes-990550394.html] and [jira-service-desk-4-8-x-upgrade-notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-4-8-x-upgrade-notes-989763769.html] at the top part of the document, it notes: "The migration runs in the background for all Server and Data Center upgrade paths (ZDU included) and does not stop Jira being operational." 

But then at the bottom of the [jira-software-8-8-x-upgrade-notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-8-x-upgrade-notes-990550394.html], under the below section, there is the conflicting note where only in case of ZDU (Datacenter Zero Downtime Upgrade) this process runs in the background. This appears to be the correct statement based on what customers are experiencing. 

!https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/files/990550394/990550386/2/1587581317563/icon_upgradeprocedure.png!   Upgrade procedure

  
 +As the result of introducing the Advanced auditing feature, we'll be migrating your old audit log (up to 10 million records) on upgrade. Depending on the platform you're using and the size of your audit log, the migration might take up to several hours.+

+If you migrate with ZDU, your migration task will run in the background, and Jira will still be accessible to users.+

You can use the\{{ }}{{jira.advanced.audit.log.migration.limit}} flag in the Jira properties file to limit the number of events you want to migrate or to turn off the migration altogether. In that case, you will only see the new events in your upgraded Audit log view, and the past events will remain invisible until you have performed the migration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Migrate to JSW 8.8/ JSD4.8
h3. Expected Results

The Audit Log Migration should run in the background upon restarting Jira after the upgrade.
h3. Actual Results

Audit log migration is happening while starting Jira after the upgrade and it takes a while to complete. 
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: Audit log migration: The JSW 8.8 and JSD 4.8 upgrade nodes documentation is providing conflicting/wrong info.

fields.description:
There are cases where system accounts and passwords (in clear text) are reported via JMX beans. One example is in the database connector bean. Accessing JMX does require a password, but we did not realize that read-only JMX access may be exposing system-level accounts.

Access to the JMX metrics might be allowed to both monitoring tools and custom plugin developers for debugging. Some beans contain passwords that shouldn't be distributed, for example, the DB Connector Bean shows the database username/password as a "metric" in the bean
fields.summary: Filter sensitive information leaked through JMX monitoring

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In "Issue Edit screen" the options for 'Select List (cascading)' being defaulted to (not available) which is not being recognized by Jira, neither the value was inserted manually.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type 'Select List (cascading)' and give the options for the select list, this happens only for the second level value in cascading list.
 # Go to filed configuration and make the field as "required" that we just created.
 # Create a new issue where give the parent value of cascading list an option, and secondary value leave as 'None' and click on "create".
 # Once the issue gets created click on "Edit" button on the left side and try to update this will throw an error stating "The filed is required" and the secondary field where we left the option "None" will be defaulted to "(Not available)" which you can't see while creating an issue and this value is being defaulted only in the "Edit issue" screen.

Attached screen recording while reproducing the issue and this seems to be related to the bug JRASERVER-62455 where it was introduced to prevent the data loss. and this was introduced in Jira version 8.8.1
h3. Expected Results

When the field value is set to "None" this should not default to "(not available)" in the Edit screen.
h3. Actual Results

While clicking on the "Edit" option the values which have "None" as default being changed to (Not available), make Jira treat the not-empty field as empty. And issue editing is only possible when the value is manually changed to None. This thing is the main problem.
h3. Workaround

You can edit a velocity template for the cascading select custom field to fix this issue.
To do so:
# open the file _<JIRA_INSTALLATION>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/fields/edit/edit-cascadingselect.vm_.
# There, edit the code on line 48 from:
#* 
{code}
        #if ($databaseParent && !$hadSelectedChildOption)
{code}
#* to:
{code}
        #if ($databaseChild && !$hadSelectedChildOption)
{code}
# After applying the change, save the file and restart the Jira node.

In Jira DC, the workaround needs to be applied separately for every node.
fields.summary: In "Issue Edit screen" the options for 'Select List (cascading)' being defaulted to (not available) which is not being recognized by Jira

fields.description:
In our multi department use of Jira, there are multiple project managers and we use categories to mark projects as closed.

Having to bother the admin everytime is non-efficient.

I would like to allow users with the "Administer Projects" permission to change the "Project Category".
fields.summary: Allow users with Administer Projects permission to change the category of a project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL filter from JIRA 7.13 does not work on JIRA 8.5
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira 7.13 a search like "customfield ~ "PRROJECT-*" showed all issues, with values like "PROJECT-1234" in customfield.
In Jira 8.5 the same JQL search term delivers an empty result. This is a CHANGE of behavior or functionality.
 # In Jira 8.5 a search like "customfield ~ "PRROJECT-" showed all issues, with values like "PROJECT-1234" in customfield.
In Jira 7.13 the same JQL search term delivers an empty result. This is a CHANGE of behavior or functionality.

h3. Expected Results

JQL query should give constant results, where as result differ 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
Please refer the screen shot{noformat}
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL filter from JIRA 7.13 does not work on JIRA 8.5

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While editing an issue in two browser tabs the first committed changes are being overwritten with the least recent updates.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the same issue in two tabs in the same browser.
 # In the first tab click in "Edit" to edit the issue and update the "Description" and click on update
 # In the second tab click "Edit" butting of the same issue and change the "Summary" and click on update.
 # Now the changes that we have made to the description in the first tab, will be removed as in the 2nd tab we have updated only the summary but not Description.

      Attached screen recording of the issue that has been reported:

 
h3. Expected Results

It should update both Description and Summary as by clicking on the "update" we are committing changes.
h3. Actual Results

Only the least recently made updates(in this case updating summary)are being considered despite that we have updated the description in the first tab
h3. Workaround

When you observed the changes are not being reflected in the second tab ( in this case it's description) try to update the description as well along with the Summary.
fields.summary: While editing an issue in two browser tabs the first committed changes are being overwritten with the least recent updates

fields.description:
As reported in JRASERVER-67162, a user with Administrator permissions to a given project but who lacks Browse permissions, is unable to click the Versions link in the settings left nav.

The result is a REST API failure message which is unfriendly to the user.

If an administrator who lacks browse cannot view/edit Versions, it would be preferred that when clicking the versions link they are presented with a more clear message to indicate they lack appropriate permissions to perform the function.
fields.summary: Improved error messaging for Administrator without Browse Project permission clicking Versions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
While it is possible to return results via REST API search using search request, there are no options to select specific fields in the JSON response. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to select specific fields to be returned in the JSON response. 

h3. Why this is important
At times, not all data is required. With configurable fields, users have the flexibility to choose the fields that are needed. 
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround at this point of time.
fields.summary: Allow configurable fields in REST API search using search request

fields.description:
*Current Feature*
 At the moment, there is no feature to restrict the notification for the tag board.

 

*Suggestion*
 It is good to have a feature to restrict the notification when the issues in the boards are tagged. So only to those issues that are tagged, restrict the notification being sent.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict notification for all tagged issues on the board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Enterprise Releases have the same support time of two years after the first major iteration of the version release date as described on the [Atlassian Support End of Life Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-end-of-life-policy-201851003.html].
h3. Suggested Solution

The EOL of the previous Enterprise Release should be tied to the release date of the new Enterprise Release, giving additional time for customers to upgrade instead of the default two years since its own release date.
fields.summary: Enterprise EOL should have date tied to Release date of new Enterprise Release

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira reports incorrectly that MySQL 5.7 database is MySQL 5.6 and won't start Jira when the dbconfig.xml has the database type set to mysql57.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install MySQL 5.7 and set the following.
{panel}
character_set_client utf8
character_set_connection utf8
character_set_database latin1
character_set_filesystem binary
character_set_results utf8
character_set_server latin1
character_set_system utf8
collation_connection utf8_general_ci
collation_database latin1_swedish_ci
collation_server latin1_swedish_ci
version 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
{panel}

 # In the dbconfig.xml set the database type to mysql57
 # Set URL to change the character_endcoding to utf8mb4
 # Restart Jira

h3. Expected Results

Jira will start and use the MySQL 5.7 database.
h3. Actual Results

Jira won't start as a result of the default settings. with the URL set with character_endcoding= utf8mb4
{noformat}
2020-04-27 08:39:23,137-0700 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR [c.a.jira.health.HealthChecks] We've found an error in MySQL supported version!
2020-04-27 08:39:23,137-0700 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [c.a.jira.health.HealthChecks] The database type in your dbconfig.xml is set up to MySQl 5.7+ and your MySQL version is 5.6 or lower. Consider using MySQL 5.6 database type instead
    See our documentation for more information on changing database type.
2020-04-27 08:39:23,137-0700 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [c.a.jira.health.HealthChecks] JIRA couldn't connect to your database
2020-04-27 08:39:23,137-0700 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [c.a.jira.health.HealthChecks] JIRA failed to establish a connection to your database.
    This could be because:
    	- Your database isn't running
    	- The configuration of your dbconfig.xml file is incorrect (user, password, or database URL etc.)
    	- There is a network issue between JIRA and your database (e.g. firewall, database doesn't allow remote access etc.)
    
    There are several other solutions you can try, review our documentation, and see what works for you.

{noformat}
h3. Old keeping for reference - Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround.

If you change the dbconfig.xml to use the database type mysql rather than mysql57 Jira starts however you will get a collation warning by the health checker stating utf8mb4 is not a supported collation.
h3. Note on Resolution
 * Steps to reproduce *are not in sync* with Atlassian guidelines how to configure MySql database.
 ** According to documentation page, [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver088/installing-jira-applications/connecting-jira-applications-to-a-database/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-5-7] {{character_set_server}} variable should be set to {{{}utf8mb4{}}}, (!) not _latin1_ like here.
 * We verified Jira 8.8.0 with MySql 5.7.24 running inside docker and MySql 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.16.04.1 running on Ubuntu using JDBC drivers 8.0.20 and 5.1.48. (i) There were no problems connecting to and using that database.
fields.summary: Jira doesn't start using MySQL 5.7 and setting dbconfig.xml database type to mysql57

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Translation for the word "edit sprint" in German is incorrect in the Jira platform. In German, it is translated as End sprint
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the language to Germany from profile > language settings
 # Create a software project Using "Scrum Software development" template
 # Add an issue to the backlog and create an active sprint
 # Here if you try to click on Edit sprint option, the Edit sprint show as "Sprint beenden" which means "End sprint" in German.
 # Here the german translation for Edit sprint is showing incorrectly on UI
 # It should show Edit sprint (Sprint bearbeiten)

h3. Actual Results

The translation show that it means End sprint (Sprint beenden)

 

*EXPECTED RESULT*

The translation should show Edit sprint (Sprint bearbeiten)
fields.summary: Wrong translation for Edit Sprint in German

fields.description:
{panel:title=Not a Jira bug| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
(i) This is not a Jira core bug, ticket created to track the problem and for transparency. 
The problem is a combination of different factors, Java platform and libraries limitations that currently exist. 
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
Under a very high load and a large number of Lucene operations on a large Lucene index, JVM starts having contention in reading {{java.lang.ThreadLocal}} variables.
To be specific {{java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.getEntry}} and {{java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.getEntryAfterMiss}} calls become very contended which leads to high CPU usage (and high LA). 

In short, it’s a combination of 3 factors:
* High *allocation rate* of _ThreadLocal_  - caused by Lucene lib (it's tracking index segments in {{org.apache.lucene.util.CloseableThreadLocal}})
** and as consequence very high number of {{java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry}} in the corresponding {{java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap}}
* *Slow GC collection* of ThreadLocal since they are weakly referenced - a "feature" of modern GC (see [JDK-8182982|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8182982])
* High *pressure* on  _ThreadLocal_ by doing high concurency reads from cache
** Jira uses _EhCache_, which uses _ReentrantReadWriteLock_ internally, which uses _ThreadLocal_ 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Large Jira instance with large Lucene (to have many segments)
* Apply high load:
**  a lot of Lucene operations 
** large number of cache reads (eg. CachingProjectRoleAndActorStore.getProjectRole)

h3. Expected Results
* Application is stable under load 

h3. Actual Results
* Application is not stable, large CPU usage
* Growing number of {{java.lang.ThreadLocal}} and corresponding {{java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry}} 

h3. Notes about the symptoms 
* Example of the stack-trace collected during the peak time:
{noformat}
"http-nio-8080-exec-9" #209 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 cpu=15490900.00 tid=0x00007f470434c800 nid=0x58f2 / 22770  pthread-id=139914765780736 runnable     java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.getEntryAfterMiss(Ljava/lang/ThreadLocal;ILjava/lang/ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry;)Ljava/lang/ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry;(ThreadLocal.java:480)
	at java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.getEntry(Ljava/lang/ThreadLocal;)Ljava/lang/ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry;(ThreadLocal.java:455)
	at java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.access$000(Ljava/lang/ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap;Ljava/lang/ThreadLocal;)Ljava/lang/ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry;(ThreadLocal.java:327)
	at java.lang.ThreadLocal.get()Ljava/lang/Object;(ThreadLocal.java:163)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$Sync.tryAcquireShared(I)I(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:514)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireShared(I)V(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1282)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$ReadLock.lock()V(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:760)
	at net.sf.ehcache.concurrent.ReadWriteLockSync.lock(Lnet/sf/ehcache/concurrent/LockType;)V(ReadWriteLockSync.java:50)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.acquiredLockForKey(Ljava/lang/Object;Lnet/sf/ehcache/concurrent/Sync;Lnet/sf/ehcache/concurrent/LockType;)V(BlockingCache.java:196)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.get(Ljava/lang/Object;)Lnet/sf/ehcache/Element;(BlockingCache.java:158)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.get(Ljava/lang/Object;)Lnet/sf/ehcache/Element;(LoadingCache.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.get(Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object;(DelegatingCache.java:108)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache.get(Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object;(DeferredReplicationCache.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.getPermissionSchemeEntries(JLcom/atlassian/jira/security/plugin/ProjectPermissionKey;)Ljava/util/Collection;(DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.java:293)
...
{noformat}
* Count of stack in the thread-dumps:
{noformat}
grep -c 'java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.getEntryAfterMiss'  jira_threads.*
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-49-49.txt:26
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-49-57.txt:3
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-50-04.txt:24
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-50-11.txt:18
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-50-18.txt:23
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-50-25.txt:25
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-50-33.txt:25
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-50-40.txt:25
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-50-47.txt:20
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-50-54.txt:26
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-51-01.txt:32
jira_threads.2020-04-23_13-51-09.txt:27
{noformat}

* memory allocation
|| Class || Number of objects || Size ||
| java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry | 880,393 | 49,302,008 | 
| java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap$Entry[]| 710 | 13,328,016 | 
| java.lang.ThreadLocal | 51,109 | 1,226,616 | 

h3. Other notes

Reference to similar problems:
*  with Elastic Search - https://discuss.elastic.co/t/indexing-performance-degrading-over-time/40229/38 
* OpenDJ - https://bugster.forgerock.org/jira/browse/OPENDJ-4027
* http://cs.oswego.edu/pipermail/concurrency-interest/2018-October/016685.html
bq. When short-lived ThreadLocals are created and die at a rate linear to application throughout, this leads to ThreadLocal maps inactive threads holding thousands or millions of entries, to extremely long collision chains, and to situations where half the CPU is spent walking those chains in ThreadLocal.get().
* https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-6625724

Note on ThreadLocal:
* ThreadLocal variables use WeakReferences as internal implementation, which are subject to different cleanup rules than normal references. 
** On G1GC, we have a time budget for maximum GC pause (a soft goal), and JVM may opt to delay the collection of WeakReferences to a cleanup of tenured space to meet that goal (it will only clean up a subset of cleanable weak references in young GC). This may cause a build-up of entries in the ThreadLocalMaps of threads.
* the following JVM parameter will give more details in GC logs about how much _WeakReferences_ are cleaned up:
** -XX:+PrintReferenceGC

h3. Workaround
A couple of options are available here:
* upgrading to Jira 8.x
** due to changes in Lucene and Jira it produces less _ThreadLocal_

* tuning G1GC
** give it less aggressive goal to allow more _WeakReferences_ to be collected
* switching to CMS
 ** based on Elastic Search examples, resolve the problem as it collects _Weakeferences_ more aggressively
 ** It's an old GC algorithm, may have more frequent peaks and longer average collection time
fields.summary: High contention in reading java.lang.ThreadLocal variables due to large number of ThreadLocalMap$Entry elements

fields.description:
The special inbound "Create Issue" (number 1) transition should be displayed in Text mode
and also in Diagram mode without having to create a Draft - and allow user to access its properties, conditions, post-functions

Creating a draft to review that specific transition's post-functions is really annoying and error prone - if draft has been forgotten and not discarded, we are in trouble to know if that draft contains relevant changes.
(I have such use case to be able to open Script Runner post-function last executions logs)

Related issues that would be relevant to fix at the same time:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63428
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37695
fields.summary: Ability to view "Create Issue" transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The field *Target value in Jira* gets too small when the value is a long string, as it can be seen in the screenshot below:
 !target-value-width.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *Cog Icon > System > External System Import > CSV*.
# Select the file [^anonymized-stripped-data.csv] on the *CSV Source File* field and click *Next*.
# Select a project to import the data into and click *Next.*
# Fill the form as shown in the screenshot below, *making sure to check the 'Map field value' box for the 'Description' field,* and click *Next.*
 !map-fields.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
The field *Target value in Jira* is wide enough to allow for reviewing and editing the value.

h3. Actual Results
The field *Target value in Jira* is extremely small, which makes it very difficult to review and edit the value.
 !target-value-width.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Admin CSV import 'Target value in Jira' field gets too small when mapping a long string value
Source maps are reported as errors in console in Safari/Firefox/IE

We would like the ability to import certain issues from a date range to an existing project. In a certain situation where you would like to merge two backups, we would like ability to import specific issues within a date range via project import.

fields.description:
h4. Problem Summary

The Jira EventPublisher service continually evaluates whether a user was deleted or not upon synchronization with Crowd. If a third party plugin is listening for these events and logging them in a table or log, then this can result in a huge number of entries being recorded.
h4. Problem Scenario

Here are the conditions by which we were able to trigger the UserDeletedEvent being repetitively published for any disabled user in Jira:
 * Within Crowd:
 ** Add a user to a local Crowd directory.
 ** Add the local Crowd directory to a Jira application configuration.
 * Perform a sync between Crowd and Jira.
 * This user now appears in Jira listed under Crowd directory.
 * Assign this user to an issue. If the user is not assigned to anything and doesn't have any content, this problem doesn't appear to occur.
 * Next, deactivate the user in Crowd
 * Again, sync Jira with Crowd.
 * The user appears in Jira as inactive.
 * In Crowd, remove the Crowd internal directory from the Jira application configuration.
 sync with Jira
 * Again, sync Jira with Crowd.
 * The user does not display in the Jira user listing though content still references his (inactive) name.
 * After the sync, one UserDeletedEvent entry appears in the _Customfield Editor for Jira_ plugin's __ AO event table.
 * But then, each time a sync occurs with Crowd, the Jira EventPublisher executes the UserDeletedEvent event and the _Customfield Editor for Jira_ listens for and reads this event and records it into its AO table. Over time, this table will fill up quickly.

This behavior affects not just the _Customfield Editor for Jira_ plugin, but any plugin listening to the UserDeletedEvent event executed by the EventPublisher.

h4. Possible Workarounds
* If the plugin has the option to disable it's event logging, do so and only enable the event log when needed to gather troubleshooting information for a specific problem.
* Another work around option might be to periodically purge old records from the AO event log table, if used.
fields.summary: Update the EventPublisher to execute the UserDeletedEvent only once when a user is deleted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Curly double quotes are being converted into Straight double quote, when passed in a Jira custom text field, Description, Summary while creating an issue via 'create issue' inline page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Custom Text Field (multi-line)
 # Add it to the required screens
 # Create an issue via the inline static page ([http://localhost:8080/secure/CreateIssue.jspa]).
 # Input the text like below for Summary, Description, and the custom text field.
{noformat}
Smart or Curly quotes : opening double quote ( “ ), and the closing double quote ( ” ). "ordinary" double-quotes ("){noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be created as per the original input for smart curly double quote in the Custom Text field, description, and Summary. It should not be converted into a straight regular double quote.
h3. Actual Results

Curly double quote is being converted into a straight double quote as per the attached screenshots.
h3. Workaround

The issue is not reproducible with Create Issue and Edit Issue Buttons.
fields.summary: Curly double quotes is being converted into Straight double quote , when passed in a Jira custom text field, Description, Summary while creating an issue via 'create issue' inline page.

fields.description: Right now Jira does not have a feature to add users in CC or BCC fields when sending out email notifications. If there are many users in the TO field and if the action is not pending on all of them, it makes sense to give the user an option to add other users in CC or BCC rather than TO field.
fields.summary: Add users to CC in Jira Notification

fields.description:
It would be great if we had an API call to Add, edit or delete the translation options for custom fields in Jira.
Today, we can only get the translation option using the expand function for the parameter "names".
fields.summary: REST API call for Custom field translation options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The text is being cut when its length exceeds the field's width in the multi-select field. This was tested in the create issue screen.

Also, in JSD, the text is being shortened in the customer portal instead of being wrapped, which is not the ideal way to display the options.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Multi-select custom field and add options with long text.
 # Add the custom field to the create issue screen.
 # Create a new issue and try to select the options in the multi-select field.

h3. Expected Results

The text should be properly displayed. Ideally, the text would be wrapped to display the entire content.
h3. Actual Results

The text that is longer than the field's width is being cut (attaching screenshot).

!multi-select-options.png|width=252,height=131!

Also, in JSD, the text is being shortened in the customer portal instead of being wrapped, which is not the ideal way to display the options.

!CustomerPortal.png|width=261,height=192!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Text Not Properly Handled in Multi-Select Field

fields.description:
Certain plugins and automation depend on the 'Status Update' potion of transitioning an issue to fire an event. However, the 'Create Issue' transition does not appear to work this way, and events that would fire under any other Status Update do not fire when creating the issue.

It would be helpful if the Create transition also fired the Status Updated event, so that other apps and/or automation can use this as a signal to run.
fields.summary: Consider the 'Create' transition as a Status update the same as transition any other time.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the jira server mobile app, the date value entered into the Due Date field does not appear to be checking what the start date was set to. As a result it will let you pick any value, even if this is before the start date.   This was reproduced at least when the language pack was set to Russian, but might also affect other language/region settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #Create a new issue in the mobile app and set the start date to some value
 # on the same issue try to set the due date before the start date

h3. Expected Results
Mobile app should prevent end users from entering invalid dates for this field, just as the web front end does. 

h3. Actual Results
It does not prevent this.
The problem comes for the next person that edits the Jira issue (not in the mobile app) that person cannot publish other edits because there exists a check to prevent invalid due dates based on the start date.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mobile app does not check start date value when enter due date value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a custom field with custom value options that contain Turkish character {{İ}}, JQL parser won't allow you to search for it:

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-16 at 3.11.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-16 at 3.12.26 PM.png|thumbnail! 

This used to work fine in 7.0, but not in 7.13 or 8.x.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with options containing {{İ}}
 # Try picking it up for JQL search

h3. Expected Results

Able to search.

h3. Actual Results

Unable to search - JQL parser invalidates the query because it things this option does not exist.

h3. Workaround

Currently the only workaround is to avoid using Turkish characters in Jira.
fields.summary: JQL parser does not allow picking up custom field options that starts with a capital I with a dot (\u0130)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

[Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html] suggests startup parameters should be added to achieve certain outcomes. However, it doesn't consistently and clearly mention those parameters need to be set to certain values.

For instance, *{{-Dhide.system.error.details}}* and *{{-Djira.startup.warnings.disable}}* are confusing as the table doesn't mention they should be set to true to hide errors details and startup warnings, respectively.

An admin may add the parameter without the value and not get the desired behaviour of the system.
h3. Suggested Solution

Either mention, at the top of the table, that those parameters have to be set to a value or add the value to be set in the notes.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Clarify documentation of setting properties and options on startup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Character '&' in group names are interpreted as '&' by Jira. Due to this when you try to remove the group from a project role, the below error prompts -
eg. group name is *Create&SR
{*color:#DE350B}Group 'Create&SR' cannot be removed from permission 'Bulk Change' since it is not a member of this permission.{color}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group with '&' in it, say Create&SR and add users to it.
# Add the group to a global permission.
# Now try to delete 'Create&SR' from the global permission.

h3. Expected Results
The group gets deleted from the global permission.
h3. Actual Results
The error in the screenshot is thrown.

h3. Workaround
The user will have to rename the group name, remove the & and try deleting. As this is not possible from the UI, user will have to edit the same in the database - [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-rename-a-group-in-jira-968662365.html]
fields.summary: Character '&' in group names are interpreted as '&' by Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the Default time zone changes from IST (GMT+5:30(Kolkata)) to the time zone (GMT+4(Baku)) the issues' timestamps are getting updated with 1 hour forwarded. (We have also verified if there are any Day list saving changes and also by updating system time zone and Jira's time zone to the same one but still, the issue persists.)

(on) This issue is reproducible only when the timezone is set to GMT+4(Baku)).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Check an issue's "updated time " when the time zone is set to (GMT+5:30(Kolkata))
 # Change the time zone from (GMT+5:30(Kolkata)) to the time zone (GMT+4(Baku)) by navigating to (Jira administration > System > "Edit settings" under General configuration and internationalization update the timezone)

h3. Expected Results

The issue "updated time" should move backward by 1hour 30 minutes as per the difference in time zone but it's moving only by 30minutes.
h3. Actual Results

The "updated time" is getting updated with timestamp 1 hour forward.
h3. Workaround
 * Change the timezone to (GMT+04:00)Dubai, Muscat, Tbilisi, Yerevan from the time zone (GMT+4(Baku), the timezone changes will work normally.
fields.summary: Timezone changes in Jira is updating issues with 1 hour forwarded

fields.description:
When releasing a version that has unresolved issues, Jira offers to move the issues to another version (see attached screenshot). This will trigger an email notifications for each ticket that is moved to the new version.

I’d like to request an option to prevent email notifications for this action, similar to the "Send mail for this update" option for bulk operations.

I’d argue that the fact that an issue is moved to a later version due to the release of a version is not usually interesting to issue watchers, as nothing specific to the issue has changed other than that it wasn’t included in a release. An option to suppress notifications would therefore prevent many uninteresting emails and allow watchers to focus on actual changes.

!image-2020-05-11-15-17-56-635.png!
fields.summary: "Release Version" should allow moving issues without sending email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The clustering monitoring page does not work in case the node name has capital / upper case characters hence not providing CPU/Memory/Uptime information. for eg: (jira.node.id = Node1)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deploy JIRA Datacenter 8.7.1
 # In the cluster.properties file, add the node name (jira.node.id) as "Node1". Different combination tried (Node1, oNOde1).
 # Another point to note is, even the node name includes upper case letter the UI displays it as lower case letter.

h3. Expected Results
 * CPU/Memory/Uptime information to be displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-11 at 6.55.53 PM.png|width=521,height=86,thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
 * CPU/Memory/Uptime information *is not displayed*:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-11 at 6.44.46 PM.png|thumbnail!  
!Screen Shot 2020-05-11 at 6.44.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
 * Remove the capital characters from the node name (jira.node.id in cluster.properties file). node name should be only with lower case characters.
fields.summary: Cluster monitoring does not work when node name has capital / upper case characters
